column4: hey guys, anyone here using vim7 deps or vim7 compiled on their system.
in dapper, of course, not edgy.
Been trying to find some debs or a decent how-to on vim7 compile that provides atleast binaries for deps or gives specific instructions on compiling them.
seriously doubt*
anyone for the vim question ( kitche ) ??
installing things that are really powerful for windows are MUCH more involved than for linux.
I've built vim from source many times.  are you having a specific problem?
not specifically, i'm at the, how do i do it stage.
you know of a good tutorial.
it's very very simple.  especially if you only want the command line version
it's just three or four steps, so I doubt there is a tutorial.
nono, i'm looking for vim-gnome/gtk/python/perl
that's just as easy, _if_ you have all the required libraries and headers
try it.  worst thing that happens is that configure complains that this, that, or the other thing is missing.
did you do apt-get remove --purge vim first before compiling from cvs?
no
just installed on top of the regular binary?
if you build from source with the default destination it will install to /usr/local and the two versions will not step on each other.
then you should make two aliases, one for /usr/bin/vim and another for /usr/local/bin/vim
you can use the --prefix=/usr   with configure it you want it to step on your binary.
hmm, ahh, ok.
but I think keeping them separate is wiser.
yea, alias sounds good to me, thanks.
